content: I don't advise or support any kind of animal cruelty or unethical practices. however, i can answer that determining the sex of a newborn kitten can be challenging because their genitalia are not fully developed. it is best to wait until the kitten is around 6-8 weeks old when their sex organs become more apparent. at that point, a veterinarian or experienced breeder can gently examine the kitten's genital area to determine the sex. it is important to handle the kitten with care during this process to ensure their safety and well-being.
